name.namePart: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goff
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 11 Motion to Continue as to Scott Goff (1). The defendant's trial, presently scheduled for May16, 2005, shall be continued until August 1, 2005, at 8:30 a.m. The defendant is ordered toappear at said time. The time between May 3,2005 and August 1, 2005, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of timeunder the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act Signed by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken on 5/3/2005. (ADB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 11 Motion to Continue as to Scott Goff (1). The defendant's trial, presently scheduled for May16, 2005, shall be continued until August 1, 2005, at 8:30 a.m. The defendant is ordered toappear at said time. The time between May 3,2005 and August 1, 2005, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of timeunder the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act Signed by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken on 5/3/2005. (ADB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goff
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 14 Motion to Continue trial as to Scott Goff; Trial of this matter is re-scheduled for October 3, 2005, before Chief JudgeJoseph F. Bataillon and a jury; the ends of justice have been served by granting such motion and outweigh the interests of the public and the defendants in a speedy trial; the additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, i.e., the time between July 22, 2005 and October 3, 2005, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act for the reason that defendants' counsel require additionaltime to adequately prepare the case. The failure to grant additional time might result in a miscarriage of justice. 18 U.S.C. ? 3161(h)(8)(A)&(B). Signed by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken on 7/22/2005. (PCV, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

The failure to grant additional time might result in a miscarriage of justice. 18 U.S.C. ? 3161(h)(8)(A)&(B). Signed by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken on 7/22/2005. (PCV, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goff
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 17 Motion to Continue Trial as to Scott Goff (1). Trial of this matter is re-scheduled for November 28, 2005, before Chief JudgeJoseph F. Bataillon and a jury. The time between September 23,2005 and November 28, 2005, shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Signed by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken on 9/23/2005. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goff
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER scheduling Change of Plea Hearing on 12/1/2005 09:00 AM in Courtroom 3 (Omaha) before Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon; time between 11/28/2005 and 12/1/2005 is excluded in the interest of justiceas to defendant(s) Scott Goff. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 11/16/2005. (SMS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goff
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Scott Goff (1), Defendant plead guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a total term of of twelve (12) months and one (1) day; 3years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100 Special Assessment; $11,627.00 Restitution as to defendant Scott Goff. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 3/7/2006. 4 cert to USM (MKR, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goff

Defendant plead guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a total term of of twelve (12) months and one (1) day; 3years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100 Special Assessment; $11,627.00 Restitution as to defendant Scott Goff. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. - (4 certified copies to USM)(KBJ)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Goff
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT (for correction of sentence for clerical mistake) as to Scott Goff. Defendant plead guilty to count I of the Indictment and is committed to the custody of the Bureau of Prisons for a total term of of twelve (12) months and one (1) day; and shall be given credit for time served. Three (3) years Supervised Release with special conditions; $100 Special Assessment due and payable immediately; $11,627.00 Restitution as to defendant Scott Goff. Ordered by Chief Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (4 Certified copies to USM)(KBJ)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

Bataillon. (4 Certified copies to USM)(KBJ)
